meanings.definition: Tragi (noun): The plural form of tragus, referring to the small pointed projection in front of the external opening of the ear.
meanings.sent1: The doctor gently touched my tragi during the ear examination.
meanings.sent2: Her earrings dangled elegantly from her tragi.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to bat at my tragi, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The tragi acted as a natural barrier, protecting the ear canal from debris.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight caught the tragi, casting a shadow on the side of her face.

meanings.definition: Tragi (adjective): Relating to or characteristic of tragedy.
meanings.sent1: The play had a tragi ending that left the audience in tears.
meanings.sent2: She wrote a tragi story that captured the essence of human suffering.
meanings.sent3: Despite the tragi theme, the actors managed to bring some humor to the performance.
meanings.sent4: The tragi events in the novel mirrored the struggles of real life.
meanings.sent5: The tragi music score added a sense of melancholy to the film.
